channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: OSX Package for Padre 0.92
item.description: Tom Eliaz returned and released a new and improved version of the binary Padre package for OSX. Please, help him track down and fix the issues!

item.title: Initial Release of Task-Jenkins Uploaded to CPAN
item.description: Jonas B. Nielsen at logicLAB is using Perl and Jenkins for continuous integration. These are the Perl modules you need to use to work with Jenkins.

item.title: Google Code-in – Fit the Third
item.description: Mark Keating (MDK) provides his 3rd and very detailed report about the status of The Perl Foundation related tasks in the Google Code=in project. Nice charts too.

item.title: Perl Documentation in Terms of Tasks
item.description: chromatic describes the problems people who are not in the core perl community face when trying to figure out what and how to use. He explains what kind of documentation he would like to see added to CPAN modules. That resonates very much with how I am planning to expand my Perl tutorials.

item.title: Syntax Highlighting Perl Debugger on github
item.description: It seems Ovid does not spend enough time on his book, blogging and moving from Amsterdam to Paris so he wrote color highlighting for the built-in debugger of Perl.

item.title: Breaking the Perl Debugger for Fun and Profit
item.description: Shlomi Fish (rindolf) writes about a few things he has done recently. The most interesting being his work on the built-in debugger of perl and how it needs more test cases. I connected him to Kevin Dawson (bowtie) who has been enhancing the Debug::Client module that is a front end to the built-in debugger. I hope they'll figure out some way to share the tasks.

item.title: New Lingua::Identify::CLD
item.description: Alberto Simões writes about his new module that is supposed to do language detection. And I was just wondering recently how could I do that automatically.

item.title: A regex for my book
item.description: Ovid showed us a horrific regex that he is going to include in his new book. First he got some comments on Facebook and then blogged about it with a modified version of the same thing.

item.title: Coding By Numbers - Episode 31 (Perl)
item.description: Steve Dalton and Craig Aspinall are discussing Perl with Jacinta Richardson, Paul Fenwick and Damian Conway during OSDC. It is a 45-min long podcast in Australian, but to my surprise, I understood most of the words.

item.title: Perl 6 in 2011 - A Retrospection
item.description: Moritz Lenz looks back how the specification hardly changed and how the two main implementation Rakudo and Niecza moved forward. He also writes about the Ecosystem and Community around Perl 6.

item.title: National Mustard Museum
item.description: JT Smith continues with his daily post about the upcoming YAPC::NA. He even discovered the YAPC::NA mailing list so to cover everyone with news. He closed the year with a post about National Mustard Museum in Madison.

item.title: Plain Black is Hiring
item.description: I am not sure how many of you know Plain Black, that's the company behind WebGUI. JT Smith, the owner is the guy organizing YAPC::NA this year. (Yeah the one recommending us to visit the National Mustard Museum).

item.title: EPO Site Redesign
item.description: Take a look at the new face of the Enlightened Perl Organization.
